Key Metrics / Impact: Acres protected, easements signed, donor support growth
Messaging:
"Protect Door County’s most important natural places—forever."
"Every acre preserved is a gift to future generations.”
Metrics: Acres protected annuallyof conservation easements signed% of priority conservation lands securedDonor engagement in land campaigns
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Protecting Door County’s most important lands and waters forever
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Showcase new preserves, visual storytelling, donor impact stories

Key Metrics / Impact: Acres restored, volunteer hours, visible improvements
Messaging:
"Caring for the lands we protect is a forever promise."
"Restoring nature, one acre at a time.”
Metrics: of acres restored or maintainedInvasive species managed (acres or species count)Volunteer stewardship hours loggedPrescribed burns or habitat improvements completed
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Caring for lands we protect—restoring habitats, improving trails
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Interactive maps, before/after stories, trail info

Key Metrics / Impact: Easements on working lands, landowner engagement, partnership
Messaging:
"Working lands are vital to Door County’s heritage, economy, and environment."
"Protecting farms, forests, and open spaces keeps Door County thriving for generations."
"Healthy working lands mean healthy waters, scenic beauty, and local food.”
Metrics: of acres of working lands (farms, forests) protectedof new conservation easements focused on working landsPartnerships formed with farmers, foresters, and landownersSoil health or watershed impact improvements trackedParticipation in landowner outreach workshops or programs
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Preserving farms, forests, open spaces—protecting local heritage and economy
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Landowner resources, storytelling on farming/forestry ties

Key Metrics / Impact: # of partnerships, joint projects, shared media mentions
Messaging:
"Together, we protect more land, water, and wildlife."
"Strong partnerships help us tackle big challenges—climate change, water quality, and habitat loss."
"Collaborating with tribes, agencies, and conservation leaders multiplies our impact.”
Metrics: of active partnerships (tribal, agency, NGO, academic)of collaborative projects completed or launchedJoint funding secured for partnership projectsNew science-based initiatives created with partnersIncreased partner mentions in media or communications
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Expanding impact through collaborations (tribes, agencies, universities)
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Stories of collaboration, partner profiles, maps of impact

Key Metrics / Impact: Event participation, social engagement, newsletter growth
Messaging: "Protecting the places we love, together.""When we care for the land, the land takes care of us.""Conservation means clean water, fresh air, and natural beauty—for everyone, now and always.""The preserves you love help protect our community from flooding, erosion, and extreme weather.""Your support keeps Door County’s landscapes healthy, scenic, and thriving—for generations to come.""We’re safeguarding the places where memories are made—hiking, birding, paddling, exploring.
Metrics: of community events hosted (hikes, talks, preserve tours)Attendance numbers and demographics at eventsof new community partnerships formed (schools, civic groups, local businesses)Growth in social media engagement (shares, comments, story reach)Newsletter open/click-through rates tied to engagement contentWebsite traffic increases on preserve and community storiesPre/post-event surveys capturing knowledge change or emotional connectionGrowth in preserve visits (if trackable) or map downloadsMedia coverage secured about community impact storiesof community-submitted photos or testimonials used in marketing
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Connecting people to nature and showing shared community benefits (quiet climate resilience thread)
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Event listings, storytelling series, volunteer sign-ups

Key Metrics / Impact: Accessibility improvements, DEIA partnerships, training completed
Messaging:
"Everyone belongs in nature."
"We’re working to remove barriers so all feel welcome on the land.”
Metrics: of DEIA-focused projects completedAccessibility improvements made at preservesPartnerships with historically excluded communitiesRepresentation in photos, stories, and programming
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Expanding who feels welcome, honoring Indigenous and diverse histories
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Land acknowledgments, updated language, diverse stories

Key Metrics / Impact: # active volunteers, volunteer hours, stories told
Messaging: "Volunteers are the heart of Door County Land Trust.""Together, we care for the lands and waters that make this place home.""From restoring trails to leading hikes, volunteers connect people to nature.""There’s a role for everyone—get involved!”
Metrics: of active volunteers annuallyof new volunteer roles created (trail stewards, education, outreach)Total volunteer hours contributedGrowth in volunteer demographics (age, background)Volunteer retention rate year over yearPublic recognition (stories, social posts, newsletters featuring volunteers)of volunteer-led event
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Showcasing people power—volunteers as the heart of conservation
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Volunteer signup pages, feature stories, social media spotlights

Key Metrics / Impact: Staff/board growth, tech upgrades, succession planning
Messaging: Strong roots, lasting impact—investing in our people and systems for the future.""Your support builds the team and tools we need to protect Door County’s lands—forever.”
Metrics: Staff growth and retention rateBoard diversity and engagementProfessional development completed (staff/board)Facility upgrades completedTechnology improvements (database, mapping, digital tools)Succession planning milestones met
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Investing in staff, board, tools, and infrastructure for mission success
Website / Digital Impact Notes: “About Us” enhancements, transparency reporting, staff spotlights

Key Metrics / Impact: Annual fundraising goals, donor retention, planned gifts growth
Messaging: "Your gift protects the places you love.""Forever is possible because of your support."
Metrics:
Annual fundraising goal progress
of new donors / retained donors% of unrestricted vs. restricted fundingLegacy society membership growth
Primary Comms Role / Messaging Themes: Protect the places you love forever—showing donor impact and legacy opportunities
Website / Digital Impact Notes: Legacy giving page, donor stories, campaign tracking
